Name: Signet ring with the name of Akhenaten
Description: This stirrup-shaped signet ring was cast as one piece. The band is rounded on the outside and becomes thicker towards the top, ending in a flat oval bezel. The seal has been used very often. The hieroglyphs, facing right, can only be discerned with difficulty. They may be the prenomen Nefer-kheperu-Re flanked by the epithet Wa-en-Aten or Mer-en-Aten.
